test_case_results.title: When a comment is added, then the page should consist of at least one HTML list item and the commentsList should be rendered using a unique key as a prop for each comment item
Page should consist of HTML main heading element with text content as "Comments"
Page should consist of HTML paragraph element with text content starting with "Say Something"
Page should consist of an HTML form element
Page should consist of HTML input element with a placeholder as "Your Name"
Page should consist of HTML textarea element with a placeholder as "Your Comment"
Page should consist of HTML button element with text content as "Add Comment"
Page should consist of HTML image element with alt as "comments" and src value as URL for comments image
Page should initially consist of HTML element with text content as "0"
When a non-empty value is provided in the HTML input element for name, then the value provided should be updated in the value of the input element
When a non-empty value is provided in the HTML textarea element for comment, then the value provided should be updated in the value of the textarea element

When non-empty values are provided in the HTML input element and HTML text area element and the "Add Comment" button is clicked, then the values inside the input elements should be updated to their initial state
When a comment is added, then the comments count should be incremented by one
When a comment is added, then the page should consist of an HTML unordered list to display the list of comments
When a comment is added, then the page should consist of at least one HTML list item to display the comment
When a comment is added, then the name provided in the HTML input element should be displayed in the comment
When a comment is added, then the comment provided in the HTML textarea element should be displayed in the comment
When a comment is added, then the comment should contain an HTML paragraph element with text containing how long ago the comment was posted
When a comment is added, then the comment should contain an HTML image element with alt as "like" and src as the URL for the Like image
When a comment is added, then the comment should contain an HTML button element with text content as "Like"
When a comment is added, then the comment should contain an HTML button element with testid attribute value as "delete"
When a comment is added, then the comment should contain an HTML image element with alt as "delete" and src as the URL for the delete image
When a comment is added, and the HTML button with text content as "Like" is clicked, then the src value of the HTML image with alt text as "like" should be changed to URL for the Liked image

When a comment is added and liked, and the HTML button with text content as "Like" is clicked again, then the src value of the HTML image with alt text as "like" should be changed to URL for the Like image
When a comment is added, and the HTML button with testid as "delete" is clicked, then the comment item should be deleted from the list of comments
When a comment is added, and the HTML button with testid as "delete" is clicked, then the count of the comments should be decremented by one
